autodoc-example 0.1 documentation

API Documentation

«  Welcome to autodoc-example’s documentation!   ::   Contents

API Documentation¶

For normal use, all you have to do is import the package:

import pkg

This will import the following:

  • My amazing Pkg class.
  • The awesome foo() function.
  • Several constants representing stuff.

Using the Pkg Class¶

class pkg.Pkg(direction, speed=30)¶

My Pkg class.

My simple Pkg class.

Note

A useful note might appear here.

change_direction(new_direction)¶

Method to allow changing the class instance’s direction attribute.

Parameters:new_direction – string

Pkg explanation goes here.

Using Foo Function¶

pkg.foo()¶
pkg.foo(value1, value2)

Pass two values and return their sum.

Parameters:
  • value1 – integer
  • value2 – integer
Return type:

integer

Constants¶

Four unneeded constants have been defined as examples:

  • NORTH
  • EAST
  • SOUTH
  • WEST
